result.execSummary:
The defendant Linda M Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Linda M Schultz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Linda M Schultz was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Linda M Schultz was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of probation of civil judgment.

No firearms; weapons.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
No contact with victim, Kenneth D., without court approval.

Successfully complete "Batterer's Intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continue programming.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Restitution is set at zero.
Particiapte in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Linda M Schultz in court.  Peter M. Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 DOC agent Adam Kramer also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.  mld
Probation Review Hearing rescheduled from 8-8-2014 at 1:30 pm, Branch 4 to 8-15-2014 at 1:30 pm, due to the unavailability of the Court.   mld

ADDRESS INFO for Linda M Schultz
Current: P.O. Box 320274, Franklin, WI 53132-6041   (Effective: 05-14-2014)
Prior: 3631 West Rawson Avenue, Franklin, WI 53132

Defendant Linda M Schultz in court with attorney Paul E Sicula.  Kristen Schrank appeared for Nicolas J Heitman for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motin of the State, Court ordered COUNT #3, dismissed on prosecutor's motion.  

 AS TO COUNT #1 and AMENDED COUNT #5:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

 AS TO COUNT #1: Defendant sentenced to serve 4 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #5), in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days time served.    COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.  

 AS TO AMENDED COUNT #5: Defendant sentenced to serve 4 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #1), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.    COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling OR Anger Management, and continue programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Kenneth D., without court approval.  
* Obtain and maintain employment.  
   ---- 25 hours of community service.   
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge, and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero.
**PROBATION REVIEW HEARING SCHEDULED FOR 8-8-2014 AT 1:30 PM.  
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

  Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   

** Defense withdraws motion for return of property.  mld

received and filed.   
  "On states motion, Court AMENDED the Charge of Count #5 to Theft, Domestic Abuse, Contrary to Wisconsin State Statutes 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), and 968.075(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor."    mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Linda M Schultz in court with attorney Paul E Sicula.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Available discovery was turned over to defense counsel from the State, including a verbal offer.  Case adjourned for an Arraignment Hearing / Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-23-2014 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail including Justice Point Supervision, no contact with named victim on the complaint and no violations of the law, are continued until further order of the Court.   mld

14RM005376  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
1/27/14 vf

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kenneth D

Defendant Linda M Schultz in court with attorney Paul E Sicula.  Defendant Linda M Schultz in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defense moves to dismiss Count 3 for lack of probable cause.  Arguments heard.  Court denies motion to dismiss.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 1 & 3.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
